lst.name: sentence
lst.str: He noted that he had appointed former Senate Republican leader Howard Baker as his new chief of staff and said he hoped Baker would help him forge a new partnership with Congress, "especially on foreign and national security policies."

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: Reagan's speech, widely regarded as critical to his hopes of repairing his presidency, was his first detailed response to last week's scorching Tower commission report on the secret sale of arms to Iran and diversion of profits to U.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: Reagan said he endorsed all of the Tower commission's recommendations about the running of the NSC, adding, "In fact, I'm going beyond its recommendations, so as to put the house in even better order."

lst.name: sentence

lst.str: Reagan's speech, widely regarded as critical to his hopes of repairing his presidency, was his first detailed response to last week's scorching Tower commission report on the secret sale of arms to Iran and diversion of profits to U.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: Reagan said he endorsed all of the Tower commission's recommendations about the running of the NSC, adding, "In fact, I'm going beyond its recommendations, so as to put the house in even better order."
